places.name: Monkey Forest
places.description: The mission of The Sacred Monkey Forest Sanctuary(Monkey Forest Ubud) is conserving the area based on the concept of Tri Hita Karana

places.name: Goa Gajah
places.description: Goa Gajah, or Elephant Cave, is located on the island of Bali near Ubud, in Indonesia. Built in the 9th century, it served as a sanctuary.

places.name: Saraswati Temple
places.description: The Pura Taman Saraswati is a beautiful water temple in central Ubud, accessible from the Jalan Kajeng side street off the main road of Jalan Raya Ubud

places.name: Luwak Coffee
places.description: Kopi luwak or civet coffee, refers to the coffee that includes part-digested coffee cherries eaten and defecated by the Asian palm civet

places.name: Pura Gunung Kawi
places.description: Gunung Kawi is an 11th-century temple and funerary complex in Tampaksiring north east of Ubud in Bali, Indonesia, that is spread across either side of the Pakerisan river

places.name: Ubud Palace
places.description: The Ubud Palace, officially Puri Saren Agung, is a historical building complex situated in Ubud, Gianyar Regency of Bali, Indonesia.

places.name: Tegallang
places.description: Tegalalang Rice Terrace is one of the famous tourist objects in Bali situated in Tegalalang Village north of Ubud Bali featured by the amazing rice terrace.

places.name: Pura Dalem Agung
places.description: Pura Dalem Agung Padangtegal, or Padangtegal Great Temple of Death, is one of three Hindu temples making up a temple complex located in the Sacred Monkey Forest Sanctuary
